SS heads outside and starts firing at the enemies.

OOC: Just blast him I'm to interested in Owlhawk and
Flicker right now.

--- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@...> wrote:
> Vlad looks at the female as though she was a bit
> crazy.
> 
> Vlad: I would prefer Vlad, Vladimir or my Khan.
> Vlady seems too... 
> familiar for me.
> 
> So barbaric, so Spheroid-like. To him, it was like
> wasting words that 
> could be best kept. It was alien to him to be called
> so familiarly. He 
> did not feel comfortable with it.
> 
> He turned back to the others.
> 
> Vlad: WHAT SAY YOU WARRIORS? SHOULD YOU GO ON AND
> CLUB YOURSELVES 
> POINTLESSLY OR FIND OUT WHY YOU FIGHT?
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "airly2000" <airly2002@h...>
> wrote:
> > ????::
> > 
> > 
> > "That's a good idea Vlady..."said the femme "Can I
> tell you Vlady?"
> > 
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "warriorazure"
> <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > As nearly as he could tell, Vlad saw no one move
> after the initial 
> > > exchange. He thought of his options. He could
> start firing, but he 
> > had 
> > > not decided which group was the best to go with.
> Those Rogues were 
> > > greater in number, but that did not prove
> anything. Ice Hellion 
> > > Warriors were many, and their prowess in combat
> did not reflect 
> > this. 
> > > The Tripredacus, on the other hand, seemed less
> organized, even 
> > though 
> > > they seemed better armed.
> > > 
> > > His declaration of being the object of the trial
> of possession 
> > might 
> > > motivate them, but he harbored no illusions. He
> was a human, 
> > unknown 
> > > to these machines. He had not proven himself,
> but was confident he 
> > > could be of some use.
> > > 
> > > Then, there was this female robot. He did not
> know who she was or 
> > > which team she was in, but it seemed as though
> she had a clear 
> > > mission, maybe even unknown to her. There had to
> be a way he could 
> > > bring her with him.
> > > 
> > > In all these options, running was not present.
> It was the cowards 
> > way 
> > > out, and Wolf Warriors were not cowards.
> > > 
> > > Or... yes...
> > > 
> > > He fired his two missile racks in the air and
> forty tiny 
> explosions 
> > > peppered the sky. He intended to make a show.
> > > 
> > > Vlad: I AM KHAN VLADIMIR WARD OF CLAN WOLF. I DO
> NOT KNOW WHO YOU 
> > ARE, 
> > > BUT I RECOGNIZE YOUR VALUE AS WARRIORS. I
> SUGGEST A TEMPORARY 
> > > CEASE-FIRE SO WE MAY DISCUSS BETTER AMONG
> EQUALS.
> > > 
> > > He knew the chances that the enemies see
> themselves as equals were 
> > > slim, but it was worth trying.
> 
>
